roleset.name: cause to occur later in time than planned, occurring later than planned

example.name: just transitive
example.text: The company said it was delaying construction because of current market conditions.

example.name: passivized
example.text: Subcontractors said they were told that [equipment orders]-1 would be delayed *trace*-1.

example.name: with EXT
example.text: After [the opening]-1 was delayed *trace*-1 30 minutes because of the crush of sell orders, Frankfurt's normal two-hour trading session was extended 75 minutes to handle the heavy volume.
example.arg: because of the crush of sell orders,

example.name: with arg 2
example.text: financing problems caused a nine-month delay in getting the product to market
example.arg: in getting the product to market

example.name: Arg 1 (most common)
example.text: The new government will brook no delay in the reconstruction of disaster areas including industrial and spiritual recovery.
example.arg: in the reconstruction of disaster areas including industrial and spiritual recovery.

example.name: Another arg 1
example.text: The delay in getting AZT to children

roleset.note: DELAY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'delay' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. No access to verbnet. No comparison. (from delay.01-v predicate notes)
DELAY-N NOTES: Base on nouns00080, delay-v.01. VN class linger-53.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from delay.01-n)
DELAYED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from delayed.01-j)
